title: Quantifying & Modeling Multimodal Interactions: An Information Decomposition Framework. (arXiv:2302.12247v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: The recent explosion of interest in multimodal applications has resulted in a wide selection of datasets and methods for representing and integrating information from different modalities. Despite these empirical advances, there remain fundamental research questions: How can we quantify the interactions that are necessary to solve a multimodal task? Subsequently, what are the most suitable multimodal models to capture these interactions? To answer these questions, we propose an information-theoretic approach to quantify the degree of redundancy, uniqueness, and synergy relating input modalities with an output task. We term these three measures as the PID statistics of a multimodal distribution (or PID for short), and introduce two new estimators for these PID statistics that scale to high-dimensional distributions. translated_title: 量化和建模多模态交互：一种信息分解框架
translated_abstract: 对于解决多模态任务所需的交互如何进行量化？最适合捕捉这些交互的多模态模型是什么？为了回答这些问题，我们提出了一种信息论方法来量化输入模态与输出任务之间的冗余度、独特性和协同性。我们将这三个衡量标准称为多模态分布（或简称PID）的PID统计量，并引入了两个新的PID统计估计器，适用于高维分布。为了验证PID估计，我们在已知PID的合成数据集和大规模多模态基准测试集上进行了大量实验。
tldr: 通过引入信息分解框架，我们提供了一种量化和建模多模态交互的方法，通过PID统计量来度量输入模态与输出任务之间的冗余度、独特性和协同性，并引入了两个新的PID统计估计器。
en_tdlr: We propose an information decomposition framework to quantify and model multimodal interactions, introducing PID statistics as measures of redundancy, uniqueness, and synergy between input modalities and output tasks, and two new estimators for these statistics.
